verses.text: 渴慕朝見　神的必蒙福 （可拉子孫的詩，交給詩班長，用“迦特」的樂器。）萬軍之耶和華啊！你的居所多麼可愛。

words.note: Often used for meeting royalty or deities.
The preceding space indicates reverence for God.
A title for God, meaning 'Lord of armies'.

verses.text: 我的靈渴想切慕耶和華的院子，我的心身向永活的　神歡呼。

words.note: The preceding space indicates reverence for God.

verses.text: 萬軍之耶和華，我的王我的　神啊！在你的祭壇那裡，麻雀找到了住處，燕子也為自己找到了安置幼雛的巢。

words.note: A title for God, meaning 'Lord of armies'.
The preceding space indicates reverence for God.

verses.text: 住在你殿中的，都是有福的，他們還要不斷讚美你。（細拉）

words.note: A musical or liturgical direction in the Psalms.

verses.text: 靠你有力量，心中嚮往通到聖殿大道的，這人是有福的。
他們經過乾旱的山谷，使這谷變為泉源之地，更有秋雨使這谷到處都是水池。

words.note: Literary/biblical way to say 'place of'

verses.text: 他們行走，力上加力，直到各人在錫安朝見　神。

words.note: A common biblical idiom for increasing strength
Literally 'to appear at court', used for appearing before God
The preceding space is a common convention in Chinese Bibles to elevate the name of God.

verses.text: 耶和華萬軍的　神啊！求你聽我的禱告；雅各的　神啊！求你留心聽。（細拉）

words.note: Often used in 'Lord of Hosts'
The preceding space is a common convention in Chinese Bibles to elevate the name of God.
The preceding space is a common convention in Chinese Bibles to elevate the name of God.
A musical or liturgical direction in the Psalms

verses.text: 神啊！求你垂顧我們的盾牌，求你看顧你的受膏者。

words.note: The preceding space is a common convention in Chinese Bibles to elevate the name of God.
Literally 'let gaze fall upon', a respectful way to ask for attention/favor
Refers to the Messiah or a king/priest consecrated by anointing

verses.text: 在你院子裡住一日，勝過在別處住千日；寧願站在我神殿中的門檻上，也不願住在惡人的帳棚裡。

words.note: The preceding space is a common convention in Chinese Bibles to elevate the name of God.

verses.text: 因為耶和華　神是太陽，是盾牌，耶和華賜下恩惠和光榮；他沒有留下一樣好處，不給那些行為正直的人。
萬軍之耶和華啊！倚靠你的人是有福的。

words.note: Often used in 'Lord of Hosts'
Classical Chinese possessive, similar to modern '的'
